column4: dd if=image.img of=/dev/sda would that work to make system image ?
i did that in reverse then i am wanting to pull hd to image
dd if=/dev/sda of=image.img that look better
if means input file... so i think your command is backwards
also, why are you doing this?
was wanting to make system image you know of better way this was just my idea
i had used dd command in past
yes, but why do you want a system image? rsync is better for incremental backups, and you can choose to not back up certain sections
there are also a ton of other backup tools for keeping smaller backup files by date
dd should be a last resort for backing stuff up
i am formatting cause i have to but would like to restore right back to as is
then... why are you formatting?
i am having hardware error if i can prove that error in windows laptop will be replaced
oh.
ok, go ahead.
laptop not showing battery or changing but just to keep it from being blamed on ubuntu when i take it back was going to install default image to it
would it be bad for the partition to be mounted ?
partitions on the drive, you mean? yes
nm found ans it would be bad need to use live image found this http://www.linuxweblog.com/blogs/sandip/20050211/image-your-hard-drive-using-dd
grep lm /proc/cpuinfo
also, i'm pretty confident it is 64-bit
